Infobox Christian leader type=Pope honorific-prefix=Pope Saint name=Evaristus image=Pope Evaristus.jpg birth_name=Evaristus or Aristus term_start=c. 99 term_end=c. 107 predecessor=[[Pope Clement I|Clement I]] successor=[[Pope Alexander I|Alexander I]] birth_date=1st century [[AD]] birth_place=[[Bethlehem]], [[Judaea (Roman province)|Judaea]] death_date=c. 107 death_place=[[Rome]], [[Roman Empire]] feast_day = 26 October '''Pope Evaristus''' (died c. 107) is accounted the fifth Bishop of Rome, holding office from c. 99 to his death c. 107.ref{{CathEncy|wstitle=Pope St. Evaristus}}refAccording to ''[[Annuario Pontificio]]'', he died in 108. He was also known as '''Aristus'''. Little is known about St. Evaristus. According to the ''[[Liber Pontificalis]]'', he came from a family of [[Hellenistic Judaism|Hellenic Jewish origin]] living in [[Bethlehem]]. He was elected during the reign of the [[Roman Emperor]] [[Domitian]], the time of the [[Persecution of Christians|second general persecution]], and succeeded [[Pope Clement I|St. Clement]] in the [[Holy See|See of Rome]]. [[Eusebius]], in his ''[[Church History (Eusebius)|Ecclesiastical History]]'' IV, I, stated that Evaristus died in the 12th year of the reign of the [[Roman Emperor]] [[Trajan]], after holding the office of bishop of the Romans for eight years. He is said by the ''Liber Pontificalis'' to have divided Rome into several "[[Titulus (Roman Catholic)|titles]]," or parishes, assigning a [[priest]] to each, and appointed seven [[deacon]]s for the city. He is usually accorded the title of martyr; however, there is no confirmation of this in the case of Pope Evaristus, who is listed without that title in the [[Roman Martyrology]], with a feast day on 26 October.ref"Martyrologium Romanum" (Libreria Editrice Vaticana 2001 ISBN 88-209-7210-7) It is probable that St. Evaristus was buried near [[St. Peter's tomb]] in the Vatican.ref[http://www.catholic.org/saints/saint.php?saint_id=633 Catholic Online – Saints & Angels: "St. Evaristus"] It is also probable that [[John the Apostle|St. John]] the apostle died during the beginning of Evaristus' reign. == References == reflist == External links == Commons categoryEvaristus I * [http://www.documentacatholicaomnia.eu/01_01_0097-0105-_Evaristus,_Sanctus,_Martyr.html Writings attributed to Pope St Evaristus] * [http://saints.sqpn.com/sainte39.htm Patron Saints Index: ''Pope Saint Evaristus''] * [http://www.catholic.org/saints/saint.php?saint_id=633 Catholic Online – Saints & Angels: ''St. Evaristus''] * Cite EB1911wstitle=Evaristus s-start s-relca s-befbefore=[[Pope Clement I|Clement I]] s-ttltitle=[[Bishop of Rome]]
